repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Convert the value to Python float on the way in.

The reasoning is that Python typing and static type checkers explicitly allow int etc. as input.
Incidentally, Cython also allows arbitrary Python numbers as input for `x: float` and `x: cython.double` arguments (converting them to C double), but not for `float | None` or `Optional[float]` that require actual Python objects.

Closes https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/5750

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -434,6 +434,53 @@ static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject * __Pyx_PyLong_FromSize_t(size_t ival) {
     return PyLong_FromSize_t(ival);
 }
 
+
+/////////////// pyfloat_arg.proto ///////////////
+
+static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject* __Pyx_PyFloatArg_FromNumber(PyObject *number, int accept_none); /*proto*/
+
+/////////////// pyfloat_arg ///////////////
+
+static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject* __Pyx_PyFloatArg_FromNumber(PyObject *number, int accept_none) {
+    // Convert any float-compatible Python number object into a Python float.
+    // NOTE: This function decrefs 'number' if a conversion happens to replace the original object.
+    // NOTE: For invalid types, the function may return the original object unchanges,

@@ -14316,18 +14318,21 @@ class PyTypeTestNode(CoercionNode):
     #  This node is used to check that a generic Python
     #  object is an instance of a particular extension type.
     #  This node borrows the result of its argument node.
+    #  Builtin subtypes or compatible types (e.g. int/float) can be coerced
+    #  to the base type automatically.
 
     exact_builtin_type = True
 
-    def __init__(self, arg, dst_type, env, notnone=False):
-        #  The arg is known to be a Python object, and
-        #  the dst_type is known to be an extension type.
+    def __init__(self, arg, dst_type, env, notnone=False, simplify_builtins=False):
+        #  The arg is known to be a Python object,
+        #  and the dst_type is known to be an extension type or builtin.
         assert dst_type.is_extension_type or dst_type.is_builtin_type, \
             "PyTypeTest for %s against non extension type %s" % (arg.type, dst_type)
         CoercionNode.__init__(self, arg)
         self.type = dst_type
         self.result_ctype = arg.ctype()
         self.notnone = notnone
+        self.simplify_builtins = simplify_builtins

commit.message:
Allow any Python number type as input to 'x: float | None' type function arguments and convert on the way in.

Closes https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/5750

Generally normalise builtin int/float (sub-)typed values to the builtin base type
when assigning or passing them to differently typed object variables.
This includes default argument values.
Fix call argument for non-builtin types.
Fix handling of literal default values by making them temp before doing a type test.
Apply temp coercion inside of PyTypeTestNode instead of "sometimes" outside.
Simplify code by creating similar method signatures.
Fix assignment of from-import names to typed variables.
Fix non-exact type checks for builtin types.
Improve type finding and float coercion of IntNode literals.

title: Allow any Python number type as input to 'x: float | None' type function arguments
